result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin M. Toney

records.addlTxt: Petition and Order for Disbursement of Fees (Submitted to Accts Payable 8/25/22. Per this order, Defendant to reimburse Richland County COC office pursuant to his payment plan; however, Defendant has made no payments to the escrow so plan is not an option; reminder notice sent with 60 days to pay in full)
Jackson Law Firm called. They have not received payment for Dean fees. Clerk has asked them to resubmit the proposed order as it did not make it to the Court's queue for signature the first time.

2:55 PM Defendant Austin M. Toney in court.  Attorney Tia G Fisher in court for Austin M. Toney.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harper informs the court of the joint recommendation of a 2 year DPA. Attorney Fisher provides the court with the plea questionnaire and diversion agreement. Defendant enters a guilty plea. Court accepts the plea of guilty. Court will enter a plea of guilty but withhold judgment for a DPA for 2 years. Attorney Harper and Attorney Fisher speak.

2:06 PM Defendant Austin M. Toney in court.  Attorney Tia G Fisher in court for Austin M. Toney.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Fisher asks for a plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:15 PM Attorney Tia G Fisher appeared by video means for Defendant Austin M. Toney. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Austin M. Toney in court. Attorney Fisher waives the formal reading and enters a NG plea. Max penalites stated.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Austin M. Toney
Current: 19 Bancroft Drive, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 02-09-2022)
Prior: 20 Bancroft Dr., Richland Center, WI 53581
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:10 AM Defendant Austin M. Toney appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. AT didn't call the public defender's office. AT has called Jenson so he has a job now. Court states that AT is sitting for child support. Attorney Forehand comment about warrant be lifted as long as he is working.  


Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Tia Fisher. Defendant to deposit $50/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 03/01/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:05 a.m. by Zoom. Appearances: ADA Forehand for the State, Def without counsel, in custody, from the Richland County Jail. ADA Forehand defers to DA Harper; notes Def has a CSA warrant as well. DA Harper asks for $2500 signature bond - no contact with the Mobil Mart. Court so orders. Def states he's seeking counsel. Court directs him to call SPD re eligibility if he's unemployed. Initial appearance set for 2/9 at 10.

In the FA case, Atty. Forehand states that the stay of sentence for Mr. Toney is now lifted and he's to serve the sentence. Toney says he never got notice of the CS matter. Court to Toney - if contesting, he'll need to file a motion.
No contact with the Richland Center Mobil Mart.
